flowchart
Interface AbstractStatement

All Known Implementing Classes:
IfStatement, PrimitiveStatement, StatementSequence, WhileStatement
public interface AbstractStatement

An instance of interface AbstractStatement is a statement, for example a primitive statement, an IF statement, a WHILE statement, or a sequence of statements. The design of class AbstractStatement is based on the Composite design pattern.

Version:
1.00 (Last update: June 8, 2008)
Author:
Dr. Wen-jun LI, Da LUO

Method Detail

paint

public java.util.List paint(int startX,
                            int startY)
Create a list of JGraph cells to represent this component. The type of the elements in the list is DefaultGraphCell.

Parameters:
startX - The x-coordinate of the top left corner of the flowchart.
startY - The y-coordinate of the top left corner of the flowchart.
Returns:
The list of cells as shown in a flowchart.

The height of this component.
